title: The Mathematician's Tome
subtitle: Advanced Math Operations
description:
# The Power of Mathematics

Math is essential for game logic! C# provides powerful math operations and the `Math` class for advanced calculations.

## Basic Arithmetic

```csharp
int a = 10;
int b = 3;

int sum = a + b;        // 13 (addition)
int diff = a - b;       // 7  (subtraction)
int product = a * b;    // 30 (multiplication)
int quotient = a / b;   // 3  (integer division)
int remainder = a % b;  // 1  (modulo/remainder)
```

## The Math Class

The `Math` class provides advanced operations:

```csharp
// Power and roots
double power = Math.Pow(2, 3);      // 8 (2 to the power of 3)
double sqrt = Math.Sqrt(16);        // 4 (square root of 16)

// Min and Max
int min = Math.Min(5, 10);          // 5
int max = Math.Max(5, 10);          // 10

// Absolute value
int abs = Math.Abs(-15);            // 15

// Rounding
double rounded = Math.Round(3.7);   // 4
double ceiling = Math.Ceiling(3.2); // 4
double floor = Math.Floor(3.8);     // 3
```

## Compound Assignment Operators

```csharp
int gold = 100;
gold += 50;  // Same as: gold = gold + 50 (now 150)
gold -= 25;  // Same as: gold = gold - 25 (now 125)
gold *= 2;   // Same as: gold = gold * 2  (now 250)
gold /= 5;   // Same as: gold = gold / 5  (now 50)
```

## Your Quest

Create a damage calculator:
1. Set base damage = 25
2. Set strength multiplier = 1.5
3. Calculate total damage: base * multiplier (use Math.Round)
4. Set player health = 200, enemy damage = 45
5. Subtract damage from health
6. Calculate how many hits until defeated (health / enemy damage, use Math.Ceiling)
7. Use Math.Max to ensure damage never goes below 10
hints: Use Math.Round() to round a decimal number: (int)Math.Round(value)
Math.Max(a, b) returns the larger of two numbers
Cast to (int) when converting from double to int
Remember to cast to (double) when dividing integers for Math.Ceiling
learningObjectives: Use basic arithmetic operators in C#
Use the Math class for advanced calculations
Use Math.Max() and Math.Min() for comparisons
